videos.title: Coinbase Dispute Chat: Worst Customer Service Ever
videos.description:
My crypto was sent over the wrong network (it is like using Verizon's network to call someone instead of AT&T's cellphone towers). Coinbase now has the ability to recovery such assets on the Polygon (a crypto network) but refuses to. 

Their customer service representatives just copy and paste from the Coinbase website information already known.

They can't even correctly troubleshoot problems and piece information together competently.

They close chats even when the customer says their issue has not been resolved.

They delay responses so that an automatic chat error occurs and force you to re-navigate to the chat to re-establish a connection to continue chatting.

They do not even explain the security concerns they are hiding behind to deny recovery of assets... therefore no transparency.

When viewing problems always switch shoes: How would you like if 3.2k was sent from your bank, able to be recovered, but your bank refuses to recover it? You'd be fine? Ok, right now give 3.2k away and prove your sentiment can be backed by facts. No one in a sane body would be okay with such a lack of effort in recovery.

If anyone has faced similar issues with Coinbase, you can let them burn by contacting your attorney general to start a case against such an incompetent, unregulated company.

videos.title: Coinbase APP  2025 Review ‚Äì Worth It or Risky?¬†(Pros¬†&¬†Cons)
videos.description:
You open the app, and it feels simple‚Äîeven if you‚Äôve never touched crypto before. That‚Äôs one of Coinbase‚Äôs biggest strengths: a clean design that even beginners can use with confidence. From Bitcoin to Solana to newer altcoins, you‚Äôve got access to a wide variety of tokens.

But here‚Äôs the flip side: the fees. Instant buys and quick swaps might look smooth‚Äîbut they hit your wallet harder than you‚Äôd expect. For regular trades, the ‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù mode has lower fees, but it‚Äôs still not the cheapest platform out there.

Coinbase also lets you earn rewards through crypto staking, which is a nice bonus. However, you're not fully in control of your wallet here‚ÄîCoinbase holds your private keys, which might be a deal-breaker for some.

And then there‚Äôs security: yes, Coinbase uses industry-grade protection, cold storage, and insurance on custodial assets‚Äîbut in 2025, it faced major criticism after a breach where support systems were compromised. No funds were lost, but personal data was leaked. That shook user confidence.

Customer support? Still a pain point. Delays, account freezes, and verification issues frustrate many users. If something goes wrong, don‚Äôt expect instant help.

‚úî Pros:

Super beginner-friendly interface

Wide range of coins supported

Offers staking rewards

Reliable brand with strong institutional backing

Cold storage for most crypto funds

‚úò Cons:

Higher-than-average fees

Not a non-custodial wallet‚Äîyou don‚Äôt own your private keys

Slow and inconsistent customer support

Recent security concerns (data breach‚Äînot funds)

So, is Coinbase worth it in 2025?
If you‚Äôre new to crypto and want a simple, trusted app to get started, it‚Äôs a solid pick. But if you‚Äôre a serious trader or someone who values full control and low fees, you‚Äôll probably want something more advanced or decentralized.

Used Coinbase recently? Tell us in the comments‚Äîwhat was your experience like?

And if this review helped you decide, hit that like, subscribe, and turn on the notification bell so you don‚Äôt miss our next review.

When selling cryptocurrency on Coinbase, transaction fees apply based on the amount sold.

For transactions under $50, a flat fee of $0.99 is charged.

For sales between $50 and $200, the fee increases to $1.99.

If you sell between $200 and $1,000, the fee is $2.99.

For amounts over $200, the fee shifts to a percentage of 1.49%.

Always factor these fees into your selling calculations, similar to checking the total cost at the store.

Understanding these fees can help you plan your transactions better.

videos.title: Hidden Fees on Coinbase You Need to Know (Crypto Trading Tips)
videos.description:
üìåüîó Visit https://nerdefi.com/coinbase for more info.

üîç Want to compare exchanges?  
https://nerdefi.com/exchanges

üéì Are you a beginner in crypto and DeFi? Start here:  
https://nerdefi.com/how-to-start-buy-crypto-and-use-defi

----------------------------------------

Coinbase does have some hidden fees you should be aware of.

First, there's the 'Spread Fee'. Imagine you're buying a sandwich for five dollars. But, when you pay, they ask for five dollars and twenty cents. That's how the spread fee works.

Coinbase could potentially mark up or down the prices when you buy or sell cryptos. They actually add a two percent spread fee to the actual market price.

So, if you buy a Bitcoin for ten thousand dollars, you're paying an extra two hundred dollars because of this spread fee.

Next, let's talk about the 'Conversion Fee'. Yep, you heard correctly, Coinbase charges when you convert one crypto to another.

For example, if you want to change your Bitcoin to Ethereum, Coinbase will charge a spread margin of up to two percent, plus an additional 'Coinbase Fee'.

This Coinbase Fee can range from a few cents to several dollars, depending on how much you're converting.

Lastly, there's the 'Withdrawal Fee'. Simply put, if you want to move your crypto from Coinbase to another wallet or exchange, Coinbase charges you for that too!

And they don‚Äôt clearly state how much this fee actually is. It varies based on the transaction size and the state of the blockchain network at the time.

Sounds a bit sneaky, right?

So, just keep this fact in mind next time you buy, convert or move your cryptos in or out of Coinbase.

It's always a good idea to be aware of these additional costs, and maybe compare with other exchanges to get the best possible deal.

No matter how small, these fees can add up, especially if you‚Äôre doing a lot of trading.

Remember: it's your hard-earned money, so knowing how and where it's spent is really important!

So, in sum, there is no such thing as a free lunch, and Coinbase is no exception!

Remember to always DYOR. (https://nerdefi.com/dyor)

videos.title: Why Is Coinbase So Expensive? - CryptoBasics360.com
videos.description:
Why Is Coinbase So Expensive? In this video, we will take a closer look at the factors that contribute to the higher costs associated with using Coinbase as a cryptocurrency exchange. We will discuss the fee structure employed by Coinbase, including the maker-taker fee model that affects trading costs. You'll learn how these fees fluctuate based on your trading volume and the different roles you play in transactions.

Additionally, we will cover the spread fee that Coinbase charges, which can impact the overall price you pay when buying or selling cryptocurrencies. We will also highlight other costs that users may encounter, such as withdrawal fees and charges for transferring funds off the platform. 

Moreover, we will address the convenience and user-friendly design of Coinbase, which plays a significant role in its pricing. This platform is tailored for those who may be new to crypto trading and value robust security and customer support. Lastly, as a publicly traded company, Coinbase must balance its operational costs with the need to generate revenue for its shareholders.

Join us as we break down these aspects of Coinbase and help you understand why its fees are structured the way they are. Subscribe to our channel for more informative content on cryptocurrency and trading strategies.

videos.title: How to Contact Coinbase Support & Get a FAST Response
videos.description:
Hi, friends!  In this video, I'm going to show you how to contact Coinbase Customer Support and get a response quickly.  

My name is Iris Medina-Elston and I am a new cryptocurrency trader/investor.  I will show you the solution to every nuisance and challenge I face, in hopes that you avoid some of the mistakes I've made in this new but exciting way of building wealth.  I sincerely wish you all the very best.  Please be mindful of how you invest your hard-earned money.  

As promised in the video, here are the questions (regarding wiring and money transfer issues) that COINBASE support asked me in our correspondence.  It will hopefully speed things, if you include this in the beginning.

"Can you tell me what error message(s) you are receiving, and/or provide a screenshot of where you're getting stuck?

Additionally, can you please provide the following:
1. Date of deposit/withdrawal/buy/sell
2. Amount of transfer
3. Last 4 digits of the bank account/card
4. Transaction hash (if sending/ receiving cryptocurrency)
5. Bank charges screenshot (if double charged or unusual charges)
6. Payment code / reference code

Please send any images or screenshots as attachments. We're unable to see images/screenshots when they are inserted in the body of your email.

After you send us the information requested above, we'll work hard to quickly address this issue. We appreciate your patience and understanding."

Also, if you want to check out my other video on SHIRYO INU you can do so by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jhtXk64-cTs&t=7s

Thank you in advance for your support.  XO - Iris

I‚Äôm not giving up. I‚Äôm speaking up.

videos.title: How to regain access to your Coinbase account
videos.description:
In this video we show you how to get back into your Coinbase account if you have been locked out for any reason. 

There are a few steps involved to get back into your Coinbase account once you've been locked out. They're similar to the steps you took when you signed up for Coinbase.

1. You'll need your Coinbase email address and password 
If you don't have access to your Coinbase.com email address, see lost email access.

If you forgot your Coinbase password, check out these password reset instructions.

2. Go to the Coinbase sign in page and enter your email address and password
You'll be prompted to unlock your account if you suspect no unauthorized activity occurred.

If you're not redirected to instructions on how to unlock your account, please try these troubleshooting steps and then sign back in. If you're still not redirected to the instructions, contact customer support.

You'll need to complete identity verification to ensure it's actually you trying to get back into your account.

The account recovery process usually takes 48-72 hours to complete but can sometimes take longer. When the recovery process has completed and your account has been verified, you will receive an email confirmation and should be able to log in to access your account. 

If you log in while the review is still in progress, you‚Äôll be required to enter the PIN code you received during the initial account recovery steps. 

Once account access has been restored, sends will be disabled for 24 hours. After that period, you should have full trading capabilities.

Did you disable your account due to fraudulent activity?
If you suspect fraudulent activity on your account, please contact Coinbase Support.

For more help, please visit: https://help.coinbase.com/en/coinbase/managing-my-account/get-back-into-my-account/account-access

videos.title: How to temporarily lock your account
videos.description:
In this video we show you how to temporarily lock your account for any reason. 

If you notice suspicious activity on your account, follow these steps right away:

Lock your account. See the details below on how to temporarily lock your account, which prevents access to your Coinbase account and restricts funds from leaving it.

Secure your email and devices. Reset your email password and check for any unfamiliar rules, filters, forwarding addresses, or recovery emails. Scan your devices with anti-virus software and ensure that your device software is updated to the latest version. This protects your accounts and devices from potential malware threats that could be used to steal your sign-in credentials to gain unauthorized access to your account(s).

Important: Once you've locked your account, you'll be required to complete account access steps to get back in.

Secure your email
Hackers may compromise your email to gain access to your Coinbase account or to try to block Coinbase emails from getting to you. 

Check if you can still sign in to your email.

If your email has been compromised, you'll need to contact your email provider to shut down your account or change your email password.

Change your email password if you still have access to the email account.

Turn on 2-step verification if you don‚Äôt already have it set-up.

If you're not receiving expected emails from us, see Troubleshooting Coinbase emails.

Recover your account
Once all of your accounts are secure and your passwords are updated, you'll need to get back in to your Coinbase account. 

Accessing your Coinbase account
Follow the steps listed in our Accessing my account help article (https://help.coinbase.com/en/coinbase/managing-my-account/get-back-into-my-account/account-access) to get started. 

Protect your account
Learn how best to protect your Coinbase account. 

2-step verification
2-step verification is by far the best way to secure your account (aside from a strong password). 2-step verification is required on Coinbase, but there are a few 2-step verification methods that are more secure than others. See our What is 2-step verification help article (https://help.coinbase.com/en/coinbase/getting-started/getting-started-with-coinbase/2-factor-authentication-2fa-faq) to learn about the different options available and which methods we recommend. 

Account security and crypto scams
There are many precautions you can take to ensure your account is safe. Here are several help articles that detail account security and avoiding crypto scams: 

Avoid cryptocurrency scams gives examples of many types of cryptocurrency scams and tips for avoiding them.

How can I make my account more secure? will show you the best account security tips and tricks.

What is phishing? highlights phishing scams and how to avoid them.

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet.

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet.

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç

Because everyone keeps asking the question of... what happens if Coinbase goes bankrupt or Coinbase Wallet is removed from the app store:

In this theoretical scenario... If coinbase wallet was removed from the app store, it wouldn't matter for you as the holder of that wallet *as long as you know your seed phrase*. If you have that seed phrase, you can quickly recover your funds within a multitude of other wallet options. There are probably hundreds of options out there that would work. Also, keep in mind - using your seed phrase creates a copy of that wallet. It doesn't delete the original!

In general, keeping your funds in cold storage (i.e. a Trezor) is better than keeping them in a hot wallet like coinbase wallet. 

I hope this helps answer your question üëç
